subject: Flash Sale (ends tomorrow) - New privacy laws + rise in lawsuits - New partner asset
preview: Fellow agency partners,    Welcome to our annual summer Flash Sale!  We are offering our Black Friday 15pack for our reseller partners (and have a promotional giveaway for our affiliate partners too!)

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed

full_threads.body:
Fellow agency partners,

Welcome to our annual summer Flash Sale! We are offering our Black Friday 15pack for our reseller partners (and have a promotional giveaway for our affiliate partners too!).

SPECIALS:

For partners using the Reseller Program:

FLASH SALE: 15pack [+$1,800/year more recurring revenue]

$328.90/year for 15 licenses. Renews at the same price.
  • Resell each license at $120/yr (plus a recommended $100-$200 setup fee)
  • Cover your cost with just three clients signing up (most agencies report 80% or more of new clients signing up with Termageddon when they sign the website policies waiver prior to site launch).
  • Renews at the same price (whether you utilize some or all licenses).
  • Have more clients? Multiple 15packs can be purchased.
  • Free swag item from shop.termageddon.com

The 15pack is now available in your Termageddon account (under "Hello" -> "Billing" -> "Buy" -> "Buy in Bulk"). Questions? Reply to this email!

For partners using the Affiliate Program:

Affiliate Promotional Raffle: $250 giveaway

For the month of August, we are giving you a raffle ticket for each client that you refer directly to us that uses your promo code (or affiliate link) at checkout.

This offer applies whether you are leveraging our complimentary client onboarding service or sending clients DIY instructions to get set up directly with Termageddon.
  • If a complimentary onboarding introduction is made in August, but the call gets scheduled for a date after August, we will still honor this as a raffle ticket.

In September, we'll randomly select a partner who will win a $250 gift card (or prepaid debit card).

Forgot your promo code? Log in and click 'Promoter Dashboard'.

Not sure how to get the message out to clients about the importance of website policies and keeping them up to date? Check out our pre-written email sequence.

LATEST NEWS:

Rise in CIPA lawsuits, now targeting US small business website owners
Privacy lawsuits are now being filed against US-based small business website owners (including one person companies) located outside of California for non-compliance with CIPA. The total damages being sought under these lawsuits appear to start at $50,000. To avoid these potential lawsuits and fees, add an opt-in consent banner to your website (provided with each Termageddon license). We have updated our overview of CIPA along with pre-written email assets for you to review and consider sharing with your clients.


More US privacy laws have passed - Nebraska, Maryland, Minnesota, Rhode Island
Over the last couple of months, four more US state privacy laws have been passed, the Nebraska Data Privacy Act, the Maryland Online Data Privacy Act of 2024, the Minnesota Consumer Data Privacy Act, and the Rhode Island Data Transparency and Privacy Protection Act (DTPPA). Rhode Island's law has separate requirements whether you are a small business or not. Although the other new laws target larger businesses, they can still apply to smaller businesses in some circumstances. No action is required at this time. You are however welcome to review our Nebraska Data Privacy Act Compliance Guide, our Maryland Online Data Privacy Act of 2024 Compliance Guide, our Minnesota Consumer Data Privacy Act Compliance Guide, and our Rhode Island Data Transparency and Privacy Protection Act (DTPPA) Compliance Guide. We'll continue monitoring changes in preparation for when these laws go into effect starting January 1st of next year.

Termageddon's President selected to be the ABA's representative to the United Nations
Donata was recently appointed by the President of the American Bar Association (ABA) to be its representative to the United Nations' Economic and Social Council, where she will be advocating for privacy rights for citizens of other nations and developing countries. We are quite proud of Donata and all that she does for the privacy industry!

NEW PARTNER ASSET:

Data Minimization Doc
Do you have clients that dislike cookie consent banners? Maybe you aren't the biggest fan of cookie consent banners either? Want to build websites and not have to stress about cookie consents at all?

With fines and lawsuits increasing due to privacy law non-compliance, one can't help but ask "How do I avoid this risk as much as possible?". Last week, we presented "6 Steps to avoiding website privacy lawsuits" for the Web Designer Pro community, and from that presentation, we put together a client-friendly Data Minimization doc (links below)!

This doc outlines some simple best practices you can take when building websites, which can help eliminate a whole bunch of privacy concerns, potentially even including the need to have a cookie consent banner. The document outlines alternative approaches to using six of the most common third party tracking technologies found on small business websites.

This document can also be shared with your clients during the proposal process. It outlines your commitment to building privacy friendly websites, where you express a focus on building websites with data minimization best practices in mind. Separate yourself from the competition by demonstrating your keen focus on privacy best practices!

Ultimately it's the client's decision whether they want to track their site users, and in some cases, tracking is required to accomplish particular objectives. However for all other clients, you can propose privacy friendly alternatives, which helps protect them as well as reduces (or even eliminates) the need for a cookie consent solution!

PDF Version (Uneditable)

Canva Template (Editable)

We hope that you found this email helpful and, if you have any questions at all, feel free to reply to this email.

Thanks!
Team Termageddon


Termageddon.com

If you have received this email by mistake, you must delete this email immediately from your system.
